definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)

sentences.english: The life imbroglio of his home, he resembles a waifs and strays same.
sentences.chinese: 他家的生活一团糟，他就像个流浪儿一样。

sentences.english: It was getting late, and the floor was still a mess.
sentences.chinese: 时候不早了，而地板上还是一团糟。

sentences.english: They queered their Three-Year Plan by their premature advance.
sentences.chinese: 他们的盲目冒进使三年计划搞得一团糟。

sentences.english: Had a Cowlick In Its Hair…And Didn't Pull a Face When Photographed.
sentences.chinese: 发一团糟，拍照的时候也没有做鬼脸。

sentences.english: Combing the hair is easy to understand too, because it would be a mess if you didn’t comb it.
sentences.chinese: 梳头发了很好理解，因为如果不去弄就会变成一团糟。

sentences.english: She boggled her first attempt at drawing.
sentences.chinese: 她试图画画，可第一次画就弄得一团糟。

sentences.english: The new building was bedevilled by elevator failures.
sentences.chinese: 这座新大楼被电梯故障弄得一团糟。

sentences.english: You really cocked up this time. What are you going to do?
sentences.chinese: 这次真是搞得一团糟，你想干什么？

sentences.english: Leicester Square is a mess at the moment
sentences.chinese: 现在莱斯特广场一团糟。

sentences.english: Since he was divorced with his wife, he turned his life topsy-turvy.
sentences.chinese: 自从他与他的太太离婚后，他的生活变成一团糟。

sentences.english: That first idea was a mess too .
sentences.chinese: 那最初的想法也是一团糟啊。

sentences.english: There must be a jinx going this house. Everything's always in a mess.
sentences.chinese: 这房子一定招了鬼了，什么事都一团糟。

sentences.english: Working out of a home office is a whole other kettle of fish when it comes to time management.
sentences.chinese: 在家庭办公中谈时间管理简直就是一团糟。

sentences.english: Several of the accounts were blundered by that new assistant.
sentences.chinese: 那个新来的助手把好几笔账搞得一团糟。

sentences.english: So do you understand now the one and only reason why your life would be a failure?
sentences.chinese: 那么现在你明白了到底是什么让你的生活一团糟的吗？

sentences.english: Yet the BNP was in a shambles even before the recent onslaught.
sentences.chinese: BNP在最近发生的系列打击之前就早已是一团糟。

definition: muddled and completely collapsing (idiom); in an awful condition/complete shambles/a total mess
lit. badly burned about the head (from trying to put out a fire) (idiom)/fig. hard-pressed/under pressure (from a heavy workload, creditors etc)
billowing smoke (idiom)/foul atmosphere/(fig.) murky atmosphere/in a turmoil
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
everything in disorder (idiom); in a hideous mess/at sixes and sevens
(lit.) a pot of porridge/(fig.) a complete mess
to mess up/to mismanage/to bungle/to confuse/to muddle
